intro: Pedicularis armatoides, commonly known as the spiked lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
